stimulusHtml: Which of the following statements is best supported by the graph?

features.html:
The amount of hearing loss a person experiences is based on hearing sensitivity. Hearing sensitivity is determined by measuring the absolute threshold for hearing. The graph shows the hearing thresholds for individuals in different age groups, measured in decibels.1

Hearing Thresholds at Different Frequencies by Age Group

  • The following hearing ranges are indicated:
    • 0 to 20 decibels: Normal Hearing Range
    • 20 to 40 decibels: Mild Hearing Loss Range
    • 40 to 70 decibels: Moderate Hearing Loss Range
    • 70 to 90 decibels: Severe Hearing Loss Range
    • 90 to 100 decibels: Profound Hearing Loss Range
  • The following 4 lines representing ages are shown:
    • 20 years
    • 40 years
    • 60 years
    • 90 years
  • All values are approximate.
  • The 20 years line:
    • Begins at frequency 125, 0 decibels
    • Remains level to frequency 1,000, 0 decibels
    • Falls gradually to frequency 8,000, 10 decibels
  • The 40 years line:
    • Begins at frequency 125, 7 decibels
    • Falls gradually to frequency 1,000, 8 decibels
    • Falls gradually to frequency 8,000, 31 decibels
  • The 60 years line:
    • Begins at frequency 125, 15 decibels
    • Remains level to frequency 1,000, 15 decibels
    • Falls gradually to frequency 2,000, 25 decibels
    • Falls sharply to frequency 8,000, 72 decibels
  • The 90 years line:
    • Begins at frequency 125, 22 decibels
    • Falls gradually to frequency 1,000, 23 decibels
    • Falls gradually to frequency 2,000, 36 decibels
    • Falls sharply to frequency 8,000, 100 decibels
  • A note indicates the figure is not drawn to scale.
1: A sound’s amplitude is measured on the decibel scale. The more intense, or louder the sound is, the higher the decibel level. The human threshold for hearing is 0 decibels.↩

choicesHtml: People in their 20s have more difficulty hearing higher frequency sounds than people in their 60s.
People who are 90 years old show no difficulty hearing frequencies at the 2,000 level when played at the 40 decibel level.
As people get older, their ability to hear higher frequency sounds decreases.
In general, a sixty-year-old person cannot hear higher decibel levels at higher frequencies.
